content.description:
7 bolts, bolted anchors

Awkward start to a higher first bolt leads to easy, flowing climbing to bolted anchor.
content.location: Furthest right climb on the main wall at DeSoto, next to the bench.

content.description:
Great beginner slab. Low angle with lots of easy big holds. First bolt is a bit run out for the grade about 15' up. The crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolts.

Right above the benches at Desoto. 
9 Bolts spaced about 6-8 feet apart. Bring 10-11 draws. Top anchors have a fixed rap ring.

Short overhanging bouldering problem.

3 bolts, fixed beaner to lower off of.

P1: Option A; Upper Ledge Start (decreases risk of decking on the ledge by minimizing rope stretch)- Pull up red fixed line 3m to a 2 bolt belay on ledge. Second can be belayed up to the ledge if desired. Option B; Direct Start - Start the climb from the ground, one bolt added to protect this section. 

Climb the steep and obvious layback crack feature above the ledge. First crux of the route is a boulder problem right off the ledge, climbing eases after the third bolt. Pull through a short overhang (second lesser crux) to enjoyable face climbing above. A final tricky finger lock move brings you to the belay ledge (2 bolts with rings). (10d)

P2: Start on right side of belay and climb up to the overhanging wall. Pull your way through the crux (after bolt 3) up the face to the ramp feature above. Follow the ramp to the right and top out at the viewpoint (2 bolts with rings). (10c)

2x 30m rappels back to the ground


Follow the trail past lower climbs until you see the obvious crack feature above and red fixed line leading to the belay ledge. 

P1: 12 bolts P2: 9 bolts

Follow the bolts up the face to an obvious dyke, step right for a few moves following the dyke feature, and then pull the crux onto the face above the bulge. 

9 bolts and anchor

Super fun slab. Crux is a bulging feature with some crazy cool holds. 11 bolts plus anchor.

11 bolts added May 10, 2020. Suggested name change to Moss Slayer.

Some of the best quality rock on the Sunshine Coast with the exception to the Sechelt area bluffs. Secluded bluff which offers a few short sport routes with a number of longer mixed routes in progress. East facing so it is nice and cool on those hot summer evenings. Usually windy so bring a warm coat for belaying.

First bolts are high so bring a clip stick if leading at your limit.

From the [car pullout](https://maps.app.goo.gl/iJt6bFa1bMeh2gGe8) walk up hill on a logging road (due South East) passing an abandon car (10 minutes).  When arriving at the fork, go right.  You should see a wooden sign with DeSoto written on it.  Take another right heading uphill toward the wall.

## Parking pullout / approach trail

- 49.528106, -123.842911
- [Google maps](https://maps.app.goo.gl/iJt6bFa1bMeh2gGe8)
